stepAnswer: The enthalpy change (ΔH) must be negative and less than TΔS
stepTitle: Given a reaction where the change in entropy (ΔS) is negative, under what conditions will the reaction proceed spontaneously at a temperature T?
choices: The enthalpy change (ΔH) must be positive and greater than TΔS
The enthalpy change (ΔH) must be negative and less than TΔS
The enthalpy change (ΔH) must be zero
The enthalpy change (ΔH) must be positive
Spontaneous at any temperature without considering ΔH
